intro: Leucospermum arenarium, commonly known as the coastal starburst, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Leucospermum arenarium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging environments.
